educational_objective: Diagnose perifollicular hemorrhage caused by vitamin C deficiency.
question_text: A 50-year-old man with alcohol use disorder is evaluated for the skin findings shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: This image shows perifollicular petechiae of the skin caused by a vitamin C deficiency, also known as scurvy (Option C). Perifollicular petechiae of the skin occur around the skin's hair follicles and represent small (â‰¤2 mm) hemorrhages, which occur due to the frailty of the capillary walls. Other signs of vitamin C deficiency include coiled (corkscrew) hairs, bruising, and impaired wound healing. Patients commonly develop gingivitis (shown), as well as gingival hemorrhages, also caused by capillary frailty.
